title: Hereâ€™s Every Device Google Is Set to Launch at the Pixel 10 Event
description: New budget Pixel Buds and an official wireless charger? Color me interested.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: New budget Pixel Buds and an official wireless charger? Color me interested.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Google's Pixel 10 launch event is expected late next month, which means it is still quite a distance away since we just commenced July. However, we're close enough for the leaks to start rolling in, and that's already begun. Of course, we expect to see four Pixel 10 devices to show up, but what else will be there? Thanks to an array of leaks, particularly from MysteryLupin on X, we know a lot about the colorways and the storage options for the smartphones, but we also know a bunch about the other devices that we can expect to see show up, and there are quite a few. The Google Pixel 10 Will Come in Some Exciting New Colors Image: Android Headlines Next month, we expect to see Google launch the Google Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, Pixel 10 Pro XL, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold, all successors to the new structure of devices that it released last year. We know that the devices will come with the new Tensor G5 chip from Google, but what else do we know? Well, now, we know about the official names for the colorways for all four devices, and some of them will be far from what we're used to. Let's also take a look at the storage options at the same time. PhoneColorwaysStorage OptionsPixel 10Obsidian, Frost, Lemongrass, Indigo128GB, 256GBPixel 10 ProObsidian, Porcelain, Moonstone, Jade128GB, 256GB, 512GB, 1TBPixel 10 Pro XLObsidian, Porcelain, Moonstone, Jade256GB, 512GB, 1TBPixel 10 Pro FoldMoonstone, Jade256GB, 512GB, 1TB The Pixel 10 will have the most vibrant options, with lemongrass being a new yellow-tinted option and indigo, well, being purplish. Moonstone will essentially be gray, and Jade will be a green option. Here Are the Colorways, Bands, and Sizes for the Upcoming Pixel Watch 4 Image: Google The Pixel Watch 3 will be in need of a successor pretty soon, and the Pixel Watch 4 will fill that gap for it. The device will come with a Wi-Fi model and an LTE model, both available in 41mm and 45mm sizes. In terms of colors, we'll see some interesting choices, including black, gold, silver, and gray. We also get a very detailed look at the different kinds of first-party bands that Google will offer for the Watch 4, and they include: Active Band Active Sport Band Crafted Leather Band Metal Mesh Band Performance Loop Band Two-Tone Leather Band Woven Band Gradient Stretch Band The Sequel to the Google Pixel Buds A-Series Could Be Coming Image: Google You might not believe it, but last year marked four whole years since Google unveiled the Pixel Buds A-Series. Those budget earbuds are crying for a sequel device, and this could potentially be the year when we see it. If the rumors pan out and the Buds 2A do materialize, they might come in these colors: Fog Light Hazel Iris Strawberry Word on the street is that the Pixel Buds Pro 2 will get a new colorway, called Sterling. A new color option is better than nothing. A Google Pixel Wireless Charger Might Be on the Horizon Too Image: Google August 20th is when Google is expected to launch its new Pixel 10 devices, and on that day, to go with those phones, we might see two new charging accessories. One is the Google Pixel Charger, which is expected to be a puck-like wireless charger. The other might be the Pixel Wireless Charger, which could be a successor to the Pixel Stand. That hopefully won't be the naming convention Google chooses to follow. Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

Google's Pixel 10 launch event is expected late next month, which means it is still quite a distance away since we just commenced July. However, we're close enough for the leaks to start rolling in, and that's already begun. Of course, we expect to see four Pixel 10 devices to show up, but what else will be there?

Thanks to an array of leaks, particularly from MysteryLupin on X, we know a lot about the colorways and the storage options for the smartphones, but we also know a bunch about the other devices that we can expect to see show up, and there are quite a few.

The Google Pixel 10 Will Come in Some Exciting New Colors

Next month, we expect to see Google launch the Google Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, Pixel 10 Pro XL, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold, all successors to the new structure of devices that it released last year. We know that the devices will come with the new Tensor G5 chip from Google, but what else do we know?

Well, now, we know about the official names for the colorways for all four devices, and some of them will be far from what we're used to. Let's also take a look at the storage options at the same time.

The Pixel 10 will have the most vibrant options, with lemongrass being a new yellow-tinted option and indigo, well, being purplish. Moonstone will essentially be gray, and Jade will be a green option.

Here Are the Colorways, Bands, and Sizes for the Upcoming Pixel Watch 4

The Pixel Watch 3 will be in need of a successor pretty soon, and the Pixel Watch 4 will fill that gap for it. The device will come with a Wi-Fi model and an LTE model, both available in 41mm and 45mm sizes. In terms of colors, we'll see some interesting choices, including black, gold, silver, and gray.

We also get a very detailed look at the different kinds of first-party bands that Google will offer for the Watch 4, and they include:

  • Active Band
  • Active Sport Band
  • Crafted Leather Band
  • Metal Mesh Band
  • Performance Loop Band
  • Two-Tone Leather Band
  • Woven Band
  • Gradient Stretch Band

The Sequel to the Google Pixel Buds A-Series Could Be Coming

You might not believe it, but last year marked four whole years since Google unveiled the Pixel Buds A-Series. Those budget earbuds are crying for a sequel device, and this could potentially be the year when we see it. If the rumors pan out and the Buds 2A do materialize, they might come in these colors:

  • Fog Light
  • Hazel
  • Iris
  • Strawberry

Word on the street is that the Pixel Buds Pro 2 will get a new colorway, called Sterling. A new color option is better than nothing.

    A Google Pixel Wireless Charger Might Be on the Horizon Too

    August 20th is when Google is expected to launch its new Pixel 10 devices, and on that day, to go with those phones, we might see two new charging accessories.

    One is the Google Pixel Charger, which is expected to be a puck-like wireless charger. The other might be the Pixel Wireless Charger, which could be a successor to the Pixel Stand. That hopefully won't be the naming convention Google chooses to follow.

    Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
